website_summaries.verdict: Handy for users who want to plug in small appliances without  reducing available outlets on surge protectors, this cord gets high marks for convenience as well as its availability in lengths up to 25 feet.
pros: Works with any appliance with a standard two-pronged ungrounded power cord, freeing up surge protectors for use with more high-powered devices
Cord is available in multiple lengths, including up to an impressive 25 feet, allowing users who need to power an appliance across an entire room to meet their needs
cons: Users who primarily need outlets for three-pronged grounded cords may not find this cord useful

customer_reviews.title: It works as intended
customer_reviews.text: They are extension cords. They do their job. Stop reading reviews about a few dollar extension cord. This item is roughly as interesting as a cup of water. If you need one, buy one. If you don't move onto the the next boring product. May I suggest reviews of a ream of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Reviewing an extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to review an extension cord but let me try... You plug it in the outlet, then plug your electronic device into it... and there is power. OH... I should probably add... Do not use in the shower (just trying to be helpful).
customer_reviews.author: JamesL

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: One of the cables stopped working after a few days of use. I guess it overheated while charging my cell phone?
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I only got one cord
customer_reviews.text: I only received one cord and I gave it as part of a present
customer_reviews.author: Mister Scooter

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Okay so, I have these lights, right? In my living room. Anyway, their flip flap patty wack cords didn't reach the electrical outlets. Gosh heckin' darn it! After crying in dark despair for several days, I began to fervently wish and pray for some sort of miracle, perhaps the living room could shrink or the lamps' cords would grow to reach the outlet. Alas, it was not to be. So I bought these. Grade A+, solved the problem right away. Yup, they're extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Serena 💚Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Will eventually short anything it powers
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to power a light. Every time I'd turn on the light it would flicker several times and then remain on. The light was cheap so I assumed the cable was fine and the light was to blame without actually testing either. Now that the light's burned out I've replaced it and the new one is doing the same so I finally tested the cable and the light. The problem is definitely being caused by the extension cable delivering an initially unsteady power supply.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Bought for use with Christmas lights worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to extend some indoor Christmas lights. Did the job and for a fraction of the price I found them elsewhere. One thing to note is I have a induction cooker and these are not rated for high wattage like that. I don’t know what might happen if I tried but to be safe suggestyou check the wattage on the device you want to use it with
customer_reviews.author: S. Savara

customer_reviews.title: Look at the picture. See those four holes. That is important.
customer_reviews.text: These are fine. But they are not grounded. They only have two holes. And that makes them a lot less useful, since so many plugs have three prongs. I should have noticed that. I didn't. But now you've been warned. I would buy another type (with three holes) next time. Can't speak to durability as I don't have anything to plug in with only two prongs :)
customer_reviews.author: Live Simply

customer_reviews.title: Nice 6 & 10ft Power Extension Cords, very flexible
customer_reviews.text: I needed some more extra extension cords and I like cable matters stuff, so I went with these 10ft & 6ft. long cords. I really like them. They are made of softer more flexible rubber. It does not have those stupid slides to open up the prong insert area. Does have a rubber plug for the single side insert area. They are only 2 prong, again like most of my devices. Has the grounded prong on the input and the 3-way output. Good for your average amp driven device.
customer_reviews.author: THXkid

customer_reviews.title: A Useful Extension Cord for Multiple Uses
customer_reviews.text: Extend up to ten feet for your multiple electrical needs, it is great for small appliances, lamps, Christmas lights and any other two prong electrical device. I like the fact that it is white in color as it looks modern, the brown one works just the same but looks very dated. I wish it was a little cheaper but otherwise it works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: PsyFusion

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I used it for my daughters lights and it’s the perfect distance for the lights and works great . Fast shipping!!! Literally 2days later!! Prime and corona virus happening and I recieved it quick. Thank you! You guys are rock stars!
customer_reviews.author: Glamorous Mama

customer_reviews.title: Standard size plugs only.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today, so I can't write about reliability, but if you are buying this planning to use both sides of the double outlet, you may want another brand. You can only fit 2 standard plugs on the double side (and that's a tight fit). I cannot pair most of my electronic plugs with a standard plug on that side. Even my cell phone charger is too wide.
customer_reviews.author: Words

customer_reviews.title: Shorts out fast
customer_reviews.text: These were great at first, normal extension cords, did what they needed to do. But not even a month after having them they started shorting out. Only used them for our lamps on the sides of the couch. Better off going to Walmart for ones that will actually last.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Great Extension Cords
customer_reviews.text: I like to have black extension cords to match black electrical cords (I use white extension cords to match white electrical cords). I think it looks better that way. These two prong extension cords in black worked great for my paper shredder and my tower fan - both of which have black electrical cords. I am glad that these came in a pack of two.
customer_reviews.author: TurboShopper

customer_reviews.title: Useful for connecting devices with short cords to wall sockets
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord is useful for used in office because you can connect devices when a short cord into the wall when the socket is too far away. I used the product to power a lamp and charge my computer and heart rate monitor. This is very useful for carrging things when the wall socket is not close enough
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Levi

customer_reviews.title: Glad i bought them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these, because i just needed a regular 2 prong extension cord. I bought the 6 foot ones. And I'm on my phone at night. And sometimes i need to charge my phone. So it helps alot.
customer_reviews.author: Kara will

customer_reviews.title: Served the purpose, hooking up Halloween candy corn lights ...
customer_reviews.text: Served the purpose, hooking up Halloween candy corn lights with a black extension cord -- inside. In retrospect, I would have ordered a longer length. However, you cannot find black extension cords at the big box stores.

customer_reviews.title: Great little extension cords for light duty

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: They're extension cords. They make it so you can plug something in farther away from the outlet than you normally would. Note that they are only two-prong, so you'll need an adapter to plug like a laptop or something with three prongs in. The length is okay, but you'll still have to be withing like 5 feet of an outlet. I will probably be buying a longer cord with three prong capabilities, but these are nice to throw in your bag or even pocket in a pinch.

product_meta.title: Cable Matters 2-Pack 16 AWG 2 Prong Extension Cord (3 Outlet Extension Cord) with Tamper Guard White in 15 Feet
feature_bullets: INDOOR EXTENSION CORD extends the length of a two prong power cable; The white extension cord is rated for indoor use with equipment such as a lamp, mobile device charger, TV, small electronics or other device with a 2 prong power cord; Polarized power extension cord can be plugged into a standard 3-prong 120V AC outlet receptacle

16 AWG GAUGE power cord extension is rated for up to 13 amps / 1625 watts to support common voltage power requirements in the home or office; Extend a short lamp cord to an outlet behind furniture or connect temporary holiday lights with these extention c %

FLEXIBLE & FLAT electric cord with a SPT-2 cord is safer and more reliable at longer distances than thinner a 18 AWG two prong extension cord; Travel friendly, lightweight slim extension cord is easy to carry along to an RV or hotel room with limited electrical outlets; Fully molded strain relief connectors provide long life and durability

SAFE & RELIABLE flat extension cord with a NEMA 1-15P polarized power plug and 3 NEMA 1-15R polarized receptacles; Rated for 13 Amps/1625 Watts to easily extend a TV power cord from an HDTV; Removable tamper guard plugs into one side of the extension cord when not in use

UNIVERSAL 2-PRONG COMPATIBILITY with most common household small appliances and consumer electronics with 2 prong cords; Cost-effective 2-Pack of extension cord 2 prong includes a lifetime warranty and product support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,398 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
